intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. minor, commonly known as the lesser eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, yellowish-green flowers with prominent yellow markings, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. The leaves and flowers are used in herbal medicine for their purported soothing effects on the eyes and respiratory system.
